title: Keen 1 Mod: "Lost in the Shadows"
content:
Well, I feel the need to announce it. I have been working on a Keen1 mod last month. It's titled "Commander Keen The Return of the Shikadi, Episode One: 'Lost in the Shadows'". It takes place after "the Universe is Toast". I wrote a storytxt.ck1 with the story, but I think it needs improvement. One of my goals with this mod is to give the perspective illusion with tiles (like Keen4).

I'll upload a screenshot of the title screen soon. The story is very simple.

---

After the defeat of Mortimer McMire, nothing special has happened, and the Universe seems to be in peace again. However, one day, when Commander Keen was listening to a sitcom with the Photacyion Transceiver, a strange transmission is heard. It was a message of the Shikadi, who plan to take over the Milky Way! They're led by someone called the "shadow master". They say their first objective is to kill Keen. Billy jumps into the BWB Megarocket and heads to Gnosticus IV.

With the help of the Oracle, Commander Keen learns who's his enemy, although very little information is known about him. He travels to the Shikadi's secret base on Umbria V, where the Omega Force Shikadi joined the Alpha Force Shikadi under the command of the Shadow Master.

However, when reaching Umbria V, the BWB Megarocket is attacked and gets serious damage. After an emergency landing, Keen begins his adventure in Umbria V, to find 4 magic crystals the Shadow Master hid in different places of Umbria V. If Keen collects the 4 crystals, he'll be able to defeat this new enemy.

---

I think I need some suggestions about the Commander Keen sprite. The height of the sprite is limited to the original Keen sprite of the Vorticons trilogy (because changing the size could cause some problems with tiles and Keen's movements), and I'd like a Keen4-looking sprite. I might also have problems with the Shikadi sprites (they replace the Gargs).

Here is a screenshot of the title screen:
[img]http://img245.imageshack.us/img245/3769/modtitlejq7.png[/img]

I expect this to be finished next year, but since it depends on my spare time, I can't promise anything. Also note that I'm online only once or twice a week.

EDIT: The vorticons are replaced by the Shadow Master. I have some ideas about it, but I won't be sure until I start making the levels.

[hr]
"Eat your veggies!"

title: new mod!
content: Yay! Looking forward to the new mod.

Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: perspective!
content: Good luck with the tileset... that's always what takes me the longest and slows me down. Try to find a new way to do something traditional, or come up with something entirely new.

title: Re: perspective!
content:
There is a patch that allows you to move the title screen around; and to make it a full screen; so you can have a nice big neat looking title; at the very least you might want to get rid of that grey border on the edges.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!
There's nothing wrong with a conservative / traditional title screen. To each their own!

title: Re: I'm sorry
content:
I'm sorry to announce that... I won't be able to add Keen4+-style tiles due to several reasons:

1) I can't draw a new Keen sprite, and the old one won't fit in a Keen4+-looking level.
2) I want to have more tiles for good-looking backgrounds and platforms, and that won't be possible due to the engine restrictions (i.e. you can't have more tiles than the original tileset in Keen1) unless I get rid of non-essential tiles.
3) If I draw more perspective tiles, it will take more time than drawing simple tiles.
4) Duke Nukum and Bio Menace have graphically great levels even without perspective tiles.

That's the only thing I have to announce. Don't worry, I won't abandon this mod. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] I've always wanted to make my own Keen levels and graphics.

About the title screen, I've thought many times about the fullscreen idea, but I won't do that unless I draw something really worthy for a title-screen. And yeah, I already knew the patch.

Following Djaser's advice, I'm posting the tileset, but only partially. I just need your opinion about the artwork, since this is the very first time I do *actual* artwork for a game or mod:

[img]http://i144.photobucket.com/albums/r176/shadowm2006/tileprev.png[/img]

I'll anyway keep a copy of the tileset bitmap which included the perspective tiles, on my harddisk, so I can use them later for something.
[hr][img]http://img136.imageshack.us/img136/983/vegetableswk2.gif[/img]

title: Re:
content:
Um, nobody seems to have noticed that I ripped and scaled some of those backgrounds from Bio Menace. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img]

But the background artifacts, the statue with blue glowing eyes, and the gray floor tiles were all drawn by me, with some inspiration (specially the statue). [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] The blue laser field was also drawn from scratch. I haven't tested it in action, but I *think* it should look pretty good when animated.

Yeah, the lollypop wasn't my best idea, and I'll probably replace it later. The donut was ripped from Keen4, but I'll try to draw one myself and add some candy to it. The blue pack thing at the left is supposed to be a pack of marsh-mellows. I hope it looks like it is.

The brown yorp is a chocolate yorp. You guess where I got the idea from. (Hint: I consider it the best Keen fangame ever made for DOS.)

The framed picture of the Shadow Master, well, it should be like the Grand Intellect picture we saw in Keen3. I drew it, converted it and reduced its colors all by myself. (It was the result of a very, very, very boring afternoon; I have adapted it to be my avatar, user account picture, and part of my mod's tileset.)

BTW, the mod's codename is "SHIKADI1". It's the name of its folder and batch file, actually.
[hr][img]http://img136.imageshack.us/img136/983/vegetableswk2.gif[/img]

After deciding to not include Keen4-style tiles, a Keen4-style sprite is obviously useless. But I never liked the Keen1 player sprite, and I don't like mods lacking a MODified player sprite. Thus, I need some help.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Xky: Good luck with the tileset... that's always what takes me the longest and slows me down.[hr][/quote]

The tileset has proved to be the easiest thing to do for my mod. I've drawn a lot of tiles, more than what I expected to have at this time, but in my opinion sprites are really difficult to do, specially Keen's one.

So, what should I do about the Keen sprite? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img]

BTW, this is my second lollypop: [img]http://i144.photobucket.com/albums/r176/shadowm2006/lolly1.gif[/img]

... and a donut drawn from scratch, replacing the one ripped from Keen4: [img]http://i144.photobucket.com/albums/r176/shadowm2006/donut1.gif[/img]

title: Re: Great
content:
It looks alright, but you're gonna have a problem with points and other tile placement useing that background. It wouldnt look good if a point is collected and either a blank tile or a random background tile appears. You can see in your screen shot that the platforms on the right would need specific backgrounds or else they wouldnt fit in right.

You might want to use a simpler main background (solid color or a 1 tile deseign) and use this for only specific areas where there arent any points.

Everything looks good so far. Keep it up!-Genius314

title: Re: Keen 1 Mod: "Lost in the Shadows"
content:
The Shikadi is a great start, but like you said it needs some work. Here's some suggestions:

It doen't seem to have much of a facial expression, perhaps you should make him look angrier (by slanting the eyes or somthing).

Another thing is that his arms seem too long and snaky, it looks like they should be at least a pixel shorter and they need a more prominent shoulder base.

Most importantly, his feet have the same 3d look as the keen 5 shikadi. Since it appears the rest of your mod has a general 2d look, his feet probably should'nt stick out like that.

title: Re: Keen 1 Mod: "Lost in the Shadows"
content:
I like the Shik, but it looks too solid; it is an energy being after all, and needs to look more electriky.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: Keen 1 Mod: "Lost in the Shadows"
content:
- For Levellass:
I think you didn't read the part where I say: "Before you start criticizing it, I have to tell you that it's work-in-progress. I posted this sketch for the sole purpose of receiving feedback on this shikadi's body proportions."

I'll add the "special effects" after making sure that his body proportions are correct. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
------
- For Freeyorp101:
It's the Garg replacement. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
------
- For Ceilick & All-Of-Above:
I'm not sure if I corrected it:
[img]http://i144.photobucket.com/albums/r176/shadowm2006/newshikadi.gif[/img]
In this image I also added some special effects, Just-In-Case (JIC), and made the second animation frame of four.

I shortened his arms too, edited his face and enhanced the shoulders. I also modified his feet, tring to make him look not so 3D. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

EDIT: By the way, if you're wondering what the light-blue pixel at the left of his mouth is, it is some sort of fang. It's something to do with the way I imagine the shikadi out of Keen 5. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] [hr]SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: Keen 1 Mod: "Lost in the Shadows"
content:
Wow, awsome job! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] I can't wait to see how it looks in your mod.

The only thing that might need modification is how big the head is. From looking at the keen 5 shikadi sprite, the shikadi's head doesnt have neck, but is part of the body. I'd make his head shorter by at least one pixel, but even without this change it looks great!

[quote]Quote:[hr]By the way, if you're wondering what the light-blue pixel at the left of his mouth is, it is some sort of fang. It's something to do with the way I imagine the shikadi out of Keen 5.[hr][/quote]

haha, for some reason I thought it was drool [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen 1 Mod: "Lost in the Shadows"
content:
It looks fat/muscely. I personaly think a mix between the old version and the new one will do fine.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Shique
content:
Yeah, the new one does look bulky. The limbs need a bit of work. The symmetry is in need of attention too. The expression looks good, though. Maybe a few light-blue or cyan highlights inside the body might make it look a bit shinier, though it takes some experimenting to get the right distribution.

Overall, this mod is looking tasty!

Btw, if you really want criticism, I suggest you spend less time defending yourself against the feedback you're getting.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

title: Re: Shique
content:
I personally like this version of Shikadi a lot! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] It looks great. I don't think it needs to look just like the original, and thus this a bit heavier version is excellent. The expression on its face is great.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: sweet
content:
Modification:
[img]http://i144.photobucket.com/albums/r176/shadowm2006/1SPR0004.png[/img]

I've officially made it a standard for my Shikadi1-6 series to have Keen wearing a red shirt. The pogo is green, supposedly an enhanced version of the one he found on Mars. Additionally, he has a blue, enhanced, neural stunner (although in episodes 3 and 5 he'll use different weapons).

Keen GBC authors should be happy now [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] ------------------

title: Re: Keen 1 Mod: "Lost in the Shadows"
content:
I don't remember exactly who saw my Tank-bot replacement graphics. I just want to say... it's toast.

Well, I decided that my mod needs a darker ambient, with a really scary monster and... you'll see "when it's done".

And the tileset, yikes, the tileset. I replaced 30% of the tiles (15% of them ripped from other games/mods) with my new, own tiles which look pretty cool. I'll leave the criticism for the betatesters though.

I got the idea, Flaose. Excellent, did you know that the Vorticon death animation has so many frames that I was using less than 50% of them? Your idea is great, I can now use all that empty space. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] ------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"
